What did Scott say or do? The background provided by Rebecca Kelly, Director of Communications to the Governor is as follows. On September 25, Scott's office received an inquiry from Associated Press requesting comments on the investigation into the isolation of Trump, officially announced on September 24, by the U.S. Republic of America, Nancy Belusi, President of the U.S. House of Representatives. Scott's office sent Associated Press a statement which he said in part: "We have a lot to learn and we must understand with consideration of this serious allegation. It seems that Congress will begin an investigation, which I believe is appropriate." Scott said that the accusation should not be underestimated or misused, adding that he hoped that Congress would be objective and transparent in the process. On 26 September, the Governor was again asked at his scheduled weekly press conference to investigate the isolation.
